Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Nicotinamide Riboside in Cardiac Ischemia-Reperfusion Injury

Trial_Design.evidence: Mice were randomised to receive either NR (50 mg/L) or vehicle control.

Participants.evidence: C57BL6/N adult male mice were used.

Intervention.evidence: Mice were randomised to receive either NR (50 mg/L) or vehicle control.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates NR's ability to protect isolated mouse hearts from ischemia-reperfusion (IR) injury.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was infarct size, assessed by TTC staining after 90 minutes of reperfusion.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Sixteen mice were randomised, with 8 assigned to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Sixteen mice were randomised, with 8 assigned to each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: NR treatment significantly reduced infarct size compared to control (mean difference = 15%, 95% CI 10% to 20%; p < 0.01).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were observed in either group.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by institutional grants.
